entry.title: Cannot log into AI Launchpad
entry.content:
Hi 

I am having trouble logging into AI Launchpad. I am following this: Use Boosters for Free Tier Use of SAP AI Core and SAP AI Launchpad | SAP Tutorials because I want to attempt this: Chatbot Development Made Easy with SAP AI Core and Build Apps 

I've done everything exactly the same using the free tier of BTP (not trial) and even tried other regions for the sub account. When trying to access the launchpad, I get to the login screen which says I cannot be authenticated. When I click forget password it doesn't send me a reset link leading to me thinking it can't find an account with my details.

entry.title: IDEAS FOR SAP
entry.content:
Hi guys,

I wanted to share an idea about two new SAP product concepts that I think could really add value if developed together: a self-driving enterprise core and an assistant

A self driving enterprise core is focused on system performance. It‚Äôs like a self-driving engine for SAP that can monitor, optimize, and even adjust workflows automatically. It helps businesses run more efficiently by reducing manual work and catching problems before they happen.

An assistant focuses on people. It helps users present their work better, communicate more clearly, and share insights easily‚Äîespecially through integration with Meta Workplace. It‚Äôs about making individuals more productive, confident, and visible in their roles.

I believe SAP needs both. Self driving enterprise core improves how the system runs. An assistant improves how people show up and work within it. Together, they offer a balanced approach.

Thanks for reading‚Äîhappy to talk more if there‚Äôs interest.

entry.title: AI use for reading existing SAP documentation to find the needed config solution
entry.content:
Dear SAP Experts,

Pls could you advise AI tool which could search in existing SAP experts blogs, OSS notes and other documentation and help to  find correct answer to questions?

 

Example: #Dispute management documentation has over 1000 pages. But I have only some few hours to find answer to question:@How often dispute case comes do collection specialist work list and where to configure the frequency? 

I would like to ask the above question to #AI tool , which can search in OSS and other SAP documents.

 

Thank you

Best regards

Marcela

Many thanks,

Judith

entry.title: How do I searched for a SAP note relates to a new NT note?
Why Is My SAP AI Core Training Job Taking Much Longer Than Reported Duration?
entry.content:
Hi Community,

I'm currently working on a machine learning pipeline using SAP AI Core, where I trigger a training job via a workflow (training.yml) that pulls a training script and executes it.

However, I've noticed that there is significant configuration time before and after the actual training begins. The model training itself takes the same amount of time as before, but there are additional waiting periods both before the training starts and after it completes. For example, in the image below, although the duration is shown as 1 minute 22 seconds, the entire execution took around 10 minutes to complete.


Is there a recommended way to optimize or reduce this setup/configuration time?

here is my training.yml code:

 

apiVersion: argoproj.io/v1alpha1
kind: WorkflowTemplate
metadata:
  name: aicore-anomaly-training
  annotations:
    scenarios.ai.sap.com/name: "Aicore Anomaly Detection Scenario"
    scenarios.ai.sap.com/description: "Pipeline for anomaly detection"
    executables.ai.sap.com/name: "Anomaly AI Core Model"
    executables.ai.sap.com/description: "Trains anomaly detection models"
    artifacts.ai.sap.com/anomalymodel.kind: "model"
  labels:
    scenarios.ai.sap.com/id: "aicore-anomaly"
    ai.sap.com/version: "1.0"
spec:
  imagePullSecrets:
    - name: tanmay-credentials
  entrypoint: anomaly-pipeline

  arguments:
    parameters:
      - name: GUID
      - name: PLANT
      - name: NODE_PARAMETERS
      - name: NODE_ID
      - name: ALGORITHMS

  templates:
    - name: anomaly-pipeline
      outputs:
        artifacts:
          - name: anomaly-aicore
            globalName: anomalymodel
            path: /app/model
            archive:
              none: {}
      container:
        image: docker.io/tanmay471/anamoly_train_optimised:01
        command: ["/bin/sh", "-c"]
        env:
          - name: GUID
            value: "{{workflow.parameters.GUID}}"
          - name: PLANT
            value: "{{workflow.parameters.PLANT}}"
          - name: NODE_PARAMETERS
            value: "{{workflow.parameters.NODE_PARAMETERS}}"
          - name: NODE_ID
            value: "{{workflow.parameters.NODE_ID}}"
          - name: ALGORITHMS
            value: "{{workflow.parameters.ALGORITHMS}}"
        args:
          - "python /app/src/main.py"

entry.title: Gemini API Integration Attempts and Current 404 Issue
entry.content:
Hi Developers,

We are encountering the following issue while integrating the Gemini model with SAP AI Core:

  • 404 Not Found is returned when calling the Deployment ID at the root URL, even when using the correct orchestration payload.

  • The deployment URL has been verified to match exactly.

  • Gemini API is confirmed to be up and running, and tests using logs captured from network activity match the expected configuration.

  • Despite this, the API call consistently returns:

    "The requested URL was not found on the server. If you entered the URL manually please check your spelling and try again."

Could you please confirm the correct deployment details or orchestration URL for the Gemini deployment, or advise on a possible workaround so we can proceed?

Best regards,
Aditya Srivastav

entry.title: SAP, AI, and Cloud: A New Era of Enterprise Systems
entry.content:
SAP Today: A Technical Perspective

When we talk about SAP today, it‚Äôs no longer just about ERP. The platform now integrates with AI, machine learning, and cloud technologies. For example, SAP S/4HANA supports real-time analytics. Instead of waiting hours for batch reports, finance and operations teams can work with live data and speed up decision-making.

Integration is another key area. Many organizations run multiple systems: CRM, HR, supply chain, and more. SAP BTP (Business Technology Platform) provides a framework that lets these systems communicate. That reduces data duplication, cuts manual steps, and gives more reliable outcomes.

There is also a notable shift toward sustainability and compliance. SAP includes capabilities to track carbon footprints, manage ESG data, and meet global reporting standards. This is now a requirement in many industries, and the platform provides tools to handle the related complexity.

From a technical view, the migration path is important. Moving from ECC to S/4HANA is not just a technical upgrade it requires rethinking processes. Many organizations use the migration to automate workflows, add predictive analytics, or connect IoT devices to ERP. It is as much transformation as it is technology.

In short, SAP is evolving beyond an ERP backbone into a digital core covering analytics, integration, compliance, and automation. The convergence of SAP with AI and cloud-native apps will continue to deepen this role.

entry.title: How Can Organizations Architect a Scalable Data Engineering Pipeline to Support Real-Time AI-Driven
entry.content:
How Can Organizations Architect a Scalable Data Engineering Pipeline to Support Real-Time AI-Driven Decision Making Across Multiple Domains?

Hello everyone,

I‚Äôm working on designing a data engineering pipeline that can support real-time AI analytics across multiple business domains, including marketing, operations, and supply chain. I want to ensure that our architecture is scalable, resilient, and compliant with data privacy regulations.

Specifically, I‚Äôm looking for insights on:

Data Ingestion & Streaming: What are the best practices for ingesting large-scale structured and unstructured data in near real-time? Which tools or frameworks are most effective for multi-source streaming pipelines?

Data Storage & Modeling: How can we efficiently store both batch and streaming data while maintaining a single source of truth for AI models? Are there recommended data lake or warehouse strategies?

Feature Engineering for AI: How can feature pipelines be automated and monitored to ensure high-quality inputs for machine learning models without introducing bias?

Real-Time Model Deployment: What architecture patterns (e.g., event-driven, micro-batching, or hybrid) best support real-time AI inference while minimizing latency?

Governance & Compliance: How do organizations ensure data privacy, lineage, and regulatory compliance while enabling agile AI experimentation?

Has anyone implemented a production-ready solution that addresses these challenges? I‚Äôd love to hear about architectural choices, tool recommendations, pitfalls, and lessons learned from real-world implementations.

entry.title: SAP Access Management Use Cases can be enabled by SAP Gen AI
entry.content:
SAP Access Management Use Cases can be enabled by SAP Gen AI


1. Real-Time SoD Conflict Detection
Use Case: Instantly identify Segregation of Duties (SoD) conflicts for any user.
Example: ‚ÄúWhat conflicts exist for user Jacob?‚Äù
Benefit: Immediate, accurate conflict analysis.

2. Risk-Based Role Review
Use Case: Review roles based on actual risk exposure and usage.
Example: ‚ÄúShow me users with SOD risk conflicts‚Äù.
Benefit: Prioritize remediation based on real impact, not theoretical risk.

3. Usage-Based Role Optimization
Use Case: Identify unused roles or transactions to streamline access.
Example: ‚ÄúWho has Z_FB02 but never used FB02?‚Äù
Benefit: Reduce access footprint and license cost by removing unused permissions.

4. Impact Simulation for Role Changes
Use Case: Simulate the effect of removing a transaction or role.
Example: ‚ÄúIf I remove FB02 from Z_FB02, who else is affected?‚Äù
Benefit: Avoid unintended disruptions by previewing changes.

5. Alternative Role Suggestions
Use Case: Recommend safer role alternatives.
Example: ‚ÄúWhat alternative roles could work instead of Z_FB02?‚Äù
Benefit: Accelerate remediation with validated, low-risk role options.

6. Executive Risk Reporting
Use Case: Explain access risks in business terms to leadership.
Example: ‚ÄúExplain our P2P risks to the CFO‚Äù
Benefit: Translate technical risks into business impact scenarios (e.g., fraud potential).

7. Visual Risk Mapping
Use Case: Generate visualizations of risk across business processes.
Example: ‚ÄúCreate a visualization of the risk in the process flow‚Äù
Benefit: Improve stakeholder understanding and audit readiness.

8. Automated Audit Response
Use Case: Generate audit-ready reports and remediation plans.
Example: ‚ÄúGenerate a slide deck for our SoD remediation progress‚Äù
Benefit: Save time and ensure completeness in compliance reporting.

9. Access Governance Across Hybrid Landscapes
Use Case: Manage access across on-premises and cloud SAP systems.
Example: ‚ÄúShow SoD violations across Cloud SAP S4 Hana systems and ECC systems‚Äù
Benefit: Unified view of access risks across environments.

10. Token-Efficient AI Conversations
Use Case: Enable deep AI reasoning without exceeding context limits.
Example: ‚ÄúSummarize top 5 risks by transaction volume‚Äù
Benefit: Fast, cost-effective AI interactions using pre-analyzed data.

üß≠ Strategic Shift for Security Teams
Instead of being data gatherers, teams become strategic risk managers:
Focus on decision-making, not data extraction.
Use AI to triage, simulate, and remediate access risks.
Maintain audit readiness with minimal manual effort.

entry.title: Generative AI Powered IAM Business Role Augmentation (GAIRA)
entry.content:
Generative AI Powered IAM Business Role Augmentation (GAIRA) is a transformative concept for modern enterprises, shifting Identity and Access Management (IAM) from manual, reactive processes to a proactive, intelligent, and efficient system.

Limitations of traditional IAM include:

- Manual Provisioning: Managing user accounts and privileges can be time-consuming and error-prone, particularly in large organizations.
- Inflexible Security: Rule-based systems often lack the context needed to detect subtle, behavioral-based anomalies indicative of modern threats, such as insider risks.
- Compliance Burden: The manual nature of access reviews and audit trail generation drains resources and struggles to keep pace with regulatory changes.
- Subpar User Experience: Slow access request workflows can frustrate users and hinder productivity.

GAIRA addresses these challenges by integrating generative AI into the four pillars of IAM:

1. Adaptive Authentication
- Risk-Based Access: GAIRA enables continuous, risk-based authentication by analyzing user behavior, location, and device in real-time. For instance, a login attempt from an unusual location could trigger additional verification steps.
- Frictionless Security: This dynamic security approach balances convenience and trust, enhancing security without burdening trusted users.

2. Intelligent Authorization
- Automated Role Management: Generative AI analyzes historical access data and user roles to recommend optimal role assignments, significantly reducing manual effort and errors.
- Contextual Access Recommendations: For access requests needing approval, GAIRA provides context-rich insights based on peer-group comparisons and historical outcomes, facilitating faster, informed decisions.

3. Streamlined Administration
- Lifecycle Automation: GAIRA automates the entire user lifecycle, from onboarding to offboarding, dynamically assigning and removing access rights based on predefined policies and roles.
- Enhanced User Experience: Users can interact with the IAM system using natural language via conversational AI interfaces, improving productivity and reducing the burden on IT help desks.
